did.unittitle: Socialist Party "Who Are the Murderers" Flyer
did.abstract: Photocopied flyer "Who Are the Murderers?" from the Socialist Party, Cleveland, Ohio, 1919.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a photocopied flyer "Who Are the Murderers?" from the Socialist Party, Cleveland, Ohio, 1919.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Socialist Party "Who Are the Murderers" Flyer #5157m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Socialist Party of Ohio (SPOH) is a socialist political party in the U.S. state of Ohio. Founded in 1901, the SPO was an affiliate of the Socialist Party of America. Since the 1972 renaming of the SPA to Social Democrats, USA, it has been the state chapter of the Socialist Party USA (SPUSA).
